revised_title: Improving Telescope Eye-Glasses for Mathematical Instruments
tldr: Mr. Ramsden describes a new construction of eye-glasses for telescopes applied to mathematical instruments. The design corrects errors caused by the spherical figure of the lenses and the different refrangibility of light. This improvement allows for better precision in measurements and a larger angle of vision. The new eye-glass system can also be easily adjusted for different magnifying powers and is suitable for various applications.
